domain_analyst.goal: Extract and normalize the action schema, parameters, predicates, and causal structure from the public information without producing PDDL. Deliver a concise, machine-readable summary for downstream orchestration.

problem_analyst.goal: Parse the two statements into structured instances. For Statement A, capture initial facts, goals, and the provided plan as a reference trace. For Statement B, capture initial facts and goals. Normalize predicate names and object identifiers without emitting PDDL.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the analysts' outputs and produce the final PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem for Statement B, compatible with the FastDownwards solver. Keep action and predicate names exactly as provided; include only STRIPS-style preconditions and effects. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

public_information: Domain summary: You can act on a set of objects using six actions with the following parameterizations: Paltry object_0 object_1 object_2; Sip object_0 object_1 object_2; Clip object_0 object_1 object_2; Wretched object_0 object_1 object_2 object_3; Memory object_0 object_1 object_2; Tightfisted object_0 object_1 object_2.
Predicates in use across the domain: cats(x); collect(x,y); hand(x); next(x,y); sneeze(x); spring(x); stupendous(x); texture(x); vase(x,y). Use these exact names and arities.
Action Paltry(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, vase x y, next y z. Effects add: next x z. Effects delete: vase x y.
Action Sip(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, cats y, texture z, next x z, next y z. Effects add: vase x y. Effects delete: next x z.
Action Clip(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, next x z. Effects add: vase x y. Effects delete: next x z.
Action Wretched(w,x,y,z): Preconditions: sneeze w, texture x, texture y, stupendous z, next w x, collect x z, collect y z. Effects add: next w y. Effects delete: next w x.
Action Memory(x,y,z): Preconditions: cats x, spring y, spring z, next x y. Effects add: next x z. Effects delete: next x y.
Action Tightfisted(x,y,z): Preconditions: hand x, sneeze y, texture z, next y z, vase x y. Effects add: next x z. Effects delete: vase x y.

Statement A initial facts: cats object_0; cats object_1; collect object_10 object_3; collect object_11 object_3; collect object_6 object_2; collect object_7 object_2; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_3; hand object_12; hand object_13; hand object_14; next object_0 object_6; next object_1 object_9; next object_12 object_11; next object_13 object_6; next object_14 object_8; next object_4 object_7; next object_5 object_10; sneeze object_4; sneeze object_5; spring object_6; spring object_9; stupendous object_2; stupendous object_3; texture object_10; texture object_11; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Statement A goal: next object_12 object_10; next object_13 object_10; next object_14 object_9.

Statement A reference plan (sequence): wretched object_4 object_7 object_8 object_2; clip object_14 object_4 object_8; wretched object_4 object_8 object_6 object_2; tightfisted object_14 object_4 object_6; sip object_14 object_0 object_6; sip object_13 object_0 object_6; memory object_0 object_6 object_9; paltry object_14 object_0 object_9; paltry object_13 object_0 object_9; wretched object_5 object_10 object_11 object_3; clip object_12 object_5 object_11; wretched object_5 object_11 object_9 object_3; clip object_13 object_5 object_9; wretched object_5 object_9 object_10 object_3; tightfisted object_13 object_5 object_10; tightfisted object_12 object_5 object_10.

Statement B initial facts: cats object_0; collect object_10 object_2; collect object_5 object_1; collect object_6 object_1; collect object_7 object_1; collect object_8 object_2; collect object_9 object_2; hand object_11; hand object_12; hand object_13; hand object_14; next object_0 object_8; next object_11 object_10; next object_12 object_5; next object_13 object_7; next object_14 object_9; next object_3 object_6; next object_4 object_9; sneeze object_3; sneeze object_4; spring object_5; spring object_8; stupendous object_1; stupendous object_2; texture object_10; texture object_5; texture object_6; texture object_7; texture object_8; texture object_9.
Statement B goal: next object_11 object_9; next object_12 object_8; next object_13 object_5; next object_14 object_7.

Guidance: Treat all names literally; objects are untyped symbols object_0..object_14. Use STRIPS-style PDDL with only positive preconditions and add/delete effects. No conditional effects, no quantifiers, no typing.

extract_domain.system_prompt: You are a careful domain analyst. Do not produce PDDL. From the public information, extract a normalized list of actions with parameters, preconditions, and effects, and list all predicates with arities. Keep names exactly as provided and present the result as clear plain text bullets.
extract_domain.prompt: Using the public information {environment->public_information}, produce a concise normalization covering the six actions Paltry, Sip, Clip, Wretched, Memory, Tightfisted. For each action list: name; parameters in order using placeholders x y z w as needed; preconditions; add effects; delete effects. Then provide a flat list of all predicates with their arities. Do not generate PDDL.

parse_instances.system_prompt: You parse instances and plans without generating PDDL. Your job is to extract and normalize initial facts, goals, and the available demonstration plan for Statement A, and a clean set of initial facts and goals for Statement B. Keep symbols exactly as written.
parse_instances.prompt: From the public information {environment->public_information}, produce two normalized instance blocks. Block A: initial facts set, goal facts set, and the given plan as an ordered list of grounded actions. Block B: initial facts set and goal facts set. Use only semicolon-separated atoms for facts and a simple ordered list for the plan. Do not create PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent planning formalisms and the FastDownwards solver. Produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem compatible with FastDownwards, using only STRIPS features. Keep action and predicate names exactly as provided by the analysts. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Integrate the normalized domain and instances to produce: 1) a PDDL domain that defines predicates cats collect hand next sneeze spring stupendous texture vase and the six actions Paltry Sip Clip Wretched Memory Tightfisted with their exact preconditions and effects; 2) a single PDDL problem that corresponds to Statement B (the second statement), using objects object_0 through object_14, with the provided initial facts and goals. Include :requirements :strips in the domain. Ensure the problem only includes the Statement B initial facts and goals. Keep names identical and output only the two tagged blocks. Inputs follow. Domain summary: {domain_spec} Instances summary: {instances_spec}
